sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
The Window.GetSelect function returns the window ID of the selected window. If the select window is the main (default) run window, then it returns defWinID (which is -1).

A selected window is defined as the window that output will be sent to. It can be invisible. When a program starts execution, the selected window is the main Run window.
sections.text_content:
The Window.GetSelect function returns the window ID of the 
          selected window. If the select window is the main (default) run 
	  window, then it returns defWinID (which is -1).
          A selected window is defined as the window that output will be sent 
	  to. It can be invisible. When a program starts execution, the selected 
	  window is the main Run window.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Window.GetSelect** function returns the window ID of the selected window. If the select window is the main (default) run window, then it returns _defWinID_ (which is -1).
A selected window is defined as the window that output will be sent to. It can be invisible. When a program starts execution, the selected window is the main **Run** window.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Window.GetSelect, not by calling GetSelect.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
          This means that you can only call the function by calling 
	  Window.GetSelect, not by calling GetSelect.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Window.GetSelect**, not by calling **GetSelect**.
